COPY
August 20, 1962
Mr. James Day, General Manager
Bay Area Educational TV Association
525 Fourth Street
San Francisco, California
Dear Jim:
I first grew to appreciate you at our Allerton House Conference
a few years ago. Your independent individuality was a refreshing
part of that session. We were then far from being an organiza¬
tional unit or homogeneous. The very fact of our varied points
of view was characteristic of the fledgling NAEB. It is a credit
to our professional pride and intelligent purpose that we have
survived. You and others have helped build an organization that,
in spite of its growing pains, has arrived. Had we not built
NAEB, there would have now to be built such an organization.
Structural and philosophical changes have and will have to be
made in NAEB as time goes on. You have affected some of the
changes and have had a part in shaping the image of NAEB. The
San Francisco Convention was a very real contribution on your
part. Such sharing of ability and ingenuity is necessary if
we are to continue to grow and serve.
These remarks are to the point of saying that you are an impor¬
tant and essential part of NAEB. Our associational success will
be accelerated with your continued participation.
I hope that I hear in error that you have considered withdrawing
from NAEB. Tell me if there is anything I can do to make NAEB
better serve its purpose. Region II is having its 1963 Conference
in Tampa, Florida, on March 29th and 30th. We will have a fine
program and would enjoy your attending. Could you bring your
wife and make a vacation of it?
With kindest regards, I am
Sincerely yours,
RDH/lt
Raymond D. Hurlbert
General Manager
